thread.title: Lion King’s daughter gives Brisbane boot for AFLW
thread.title_full: Lion King’s daughter gives Brisbane boot for AFLW

title: Lion King’s daughter gives Brisbane boot for AFLW
text:
ANY parent will tell you that it can be hard to control your kids. 
That’s apparently true even if you’re Brisbane Lions champion Jonathan Brown. 
The Fox Footy commentator had a stellar career in the maroon and gold but that’s not keeping his seven-year-old daughter Olivia from making her own footy fandom decisions. 
Olivia is a committed Carlton fan, having revealed the switch to her dad in the middle of 2016 when the Blues were flying high at 6-5 as the Lions languished at 1-10. 
Thanks to her dad’s media jobs, Olivia has had the chance to meet some of her favourites including AFLW star Darcy Vescio and AFL captain Marc Murphy. Jonathan Brown’s seven-year-old daughter Olivia with Carlton’s Darcy Vescio and Marc Murphy. Credit: Nova Source: Supplied 
The youngster will in fact lead Vescio and the rest of the Blues’ women’s team out onto Ikon Park as team mascot for the opening match of the inaugural season on Friday night. 
That’s despite, we imagine, the protests of her dad. After all, the Lions do have a women’s team as well. 
He was surely looking forward to the day one of his kids ran out onto a footy field with an AFL club. But he probably didn’t imagine it would be in navy blue.

AFL: Reporter Katherine Loughnan went to the AFLW Giants training ahead of the inaugral womens competition. February 3rd 2017
